Title:
Patellariopsidaceae fam. nov. with sexual-asexual inter
connection and a new host record for Cheirospora botryospora
(Vibrisseaceae, Ascomycota)
Keywords:
Ascomycetes  Cheirospora botryospora  Coelomycetes 
Leotiomycetes  Pezizomycotina
Abstract:
Helotiales is a polyphyletic order of Ascomycetes. The
paucity of relevant molecular data and unclear connections of sexual and
asexual morphs present challenges in resolving taxa within this order.
In the present study, Patellariopsidaceae fam. nov., the asexual morph
of Patellariopsis atrovinosa, and a new record of Cheirospora
botryospora (Vibrissiaceae) on Fagus sylvatica (Fagaceae) from Italy are
discussed based on morphology and molecular phylogeny. Phylogenetic
analyses based on sequence data of combined LSU and ITS were used to
improve the phylogenetic resolution in the polyphyletic Helotiales. The
results of this research have paved a solid base to the taxonomy and
phylogeny of Helotiales.
